dialog.text: Shadow... why do you feel so big and scary inside me?
dialog.instructions: Voice: young boy, nervous curiosity, soft inhale at start, tentative pace, rising intonation at end.

dialog.text: Because I've been carrying the hurts you couldn't hold — I grew to protect you from feeling them again.
dialog.instructions: Voice: deep, calm, patient, low steady pace, warm timbre, gentle reassurance.

dialog.text: But I don't want to be afraid of myself anymore. How do I make you small?
dialog.instructions: Voice: frustrated then hopeful, quicker words turning to slow, searching tone.

dialog.text: Not small — known. When you stop fighting and look with kind eyes, I stop shouting for attention.
dialog.instructions: Voice: soothing, clear enunciation, slow cadence, compassionate smile in tone.

dialog.text: Name it? Welcome it? What if it hurts too much to look?
dialog.instructions: Voice: trembling vulnerability, breathy, pauses between phrases, childlike honesty.

dialog.text: It might. Pain is the doorway, not the prison. Breathe into it, listen without judgment, and you'll find the story beneath the alarm.
dialog.instructions: Voice: calm teacherly warmth, steady breath, deliberate pacing, encouraging.

dialog.text: How do I even begin? I get lost in the panic and run away.
dialog.instructions: Voice: quick admission, then softer, almost whispering at the end.

dialog.text: Begin with one breath. Name one feeling: scared, lonely, ashamed. Say it softly. When attention meets a wound, the wound loosens — curiosity is a kind healer.
dialog.instructions: Voice: clear, precise, gentle urgency, slight upward inflection on the instruction.

dialog.text: So choosing to stay is actually how I get free? That sounds impossible and brave at once.
dialog.instructions: Voice: small laugh of disbelief, then steadier resolve, warm vulnerability.

dialog.text: Yes. Choice is the smallest brave act with the biggest ripple. Each time you choose presence instead of hiding, the shadow shifts from enemy to teacher.
dialog.instructions: Voice: affirming, resonant, steady rhythm, slightly inspirational.

dialog.text: Will I ever stop being scared of you?
dialog.instructions: Voice: quiet, hopeful question, almost a plea, slow and soft.

dialog.text: You won't erase me — you will learn to dance with me. Freedom isn't absence of shadow; it's walking with it without letting it lead.
dialog.instructions: Voice: warm conviction, gentle humor underlined, steady comforting rhythm.

dialog.text: I want to try. I'll breathe and invite whatever is there to be seen.
dialog.instructions: Voice: determined, calm, small smile in tone, steady pace.

dialog.text: Good. Start now: breathe once, name one feeling, and say, 'I see you.' That tiny ceremony wakes peace more than you think.
dialog.instructions: Voice: whisper-to-encourage, intimate, soft but clear, slow and deliberate.

dialog.text: Try it for one minute. Notice what changes, then share what you felt in the comments — your small witnessing might awaken someone else.
dialog.instructions: Voice: warm invitation, friendly, quiet urgency, gentle smile, slightly faster at the end.
